Orphapacket.Label: Susceptibility to viral and mycobacterial infections due to STAT1 deficiency

Synonyms.Synonym: Predisposition to severe viral infection due to STAT1 deficiency

ExternalReferences.DisorderMappingRelation: E (Exact mapping: the two concepts are equivalent)

TextSection.Contents: Susceptibility to viral and mycobacterial infections is a rare genetic primary immunodeficiency due to a defect in innate immunity disorder characterized by impaired intracellular signaling from both type I and type II interferons leading to early-onset severe life-threatening intracellular bacterial (typically mycobacteria) and viral (mainly herpes viruses) infections.

Gene.Name: signal transducer and activator of transcription 1

Parent.Label: Genetic susceptibility to infections due to particular pathogens
